recipe.name: 8 Day Dill Pickle
recipe.preparation: First day:  cut cukes into bite sized chunks.  Brine 2 cups salt, 1 1/2 gallon water and soak overnight.Second day:  Drain.  Pour boiling water to cover.  Add 3 Tbsp alum and 1/2 box dill seed.  Stand 2 days.Fourth day: Drain and rinse.  Boil 3 quarts vinegar, 2 quarts water, 3 quarts sugar, 1 box pickling spice, some peppercorns and 2 cloves garlic.  Add heads of large of dill.  Heat for 5 minutes and turn off heat.  Add pickles.  Stir daily for 4 days.Eighth day.  Remove pickle and peel in sterilized jars (makes 8 quarts).  Bring syrup to boil and pour over pickles.  Seal.
